page.title: 17HAMPTON DRAW DOCK
page.content: The{Hampton Draw Dock was important {to the water companies}in the late nineteenth century because at that time the roads were not good and the {fuel used by the engines driving the {water pumps was coal}and so transportation by sailing barge became the obvious solution. At first six large steam engines drove the pumps which forced the water through the mains and the amount of fuel needed was immense. Over recent years{the steam engines have been {replaced by electric turbine engines and consequently the dock has been decreasing in importance. { On the 5th of July 1985 the last {steam pump was shut down}by 93 year old Mr.Woodcock who had worked at the waterworks for most of his life.
